docs.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH - President Obama brought his health care sales pitch to the South on Wednesday, telling people at a local high school that aside from benefitting those who are uninsured now, health reform will mean more security and stability for Americans who already have health insurance.

headline.main: Obama Tries to Pitch Health Care on a Consumer Level

docs.abstract: Facing worrying public opinion among those who have health care, the president adjusts his message a bit to emphasize what he wants to guarantee in any plan.
docs.snippet: Facing worrying public opinion among those who have health care, the president adjusts his message a bit to emphasize what he wants to guarantee in any plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: "First, do no harm." Evidently those words don't apply to Congress and health care reform, at least not as it pertains to small business.

headline.main: UPDATED: First, Do No Harm to Small Business?

docs.abstract: Before it rushes to pass health-care legislation, Congress should determine what share of small business profits will be eaten up by the proposed health insurance penalty -- and how many jobs will be lost.
docs.snippet: Before it rushes to pass health-care legislation, Congress should determine what share of small business profits will be eaten up by the proposed health insurance penalty -- and how many jobs will be lost.

headline.main: Morning Skim: Iraq Attacks, Stock Signals, Conservative Despair and More

docs.abstract: Is a recent anti-terror operation in Iraq being cheered in Tehran?
docs.snippet: Is a recent anti-terror operation in Iraq being cheered in Tehran?

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama takes his message on the road again today, heading to Raleigh, N.C., and then to Bristol, Va., for back-to-back sales pitches on health care.
docs.abstract: With Congress tangled up in negotiations over health care, the president takes his show back on the road.
docs.snippet: With Congress tangled up in negotiations over health care, the president takes his show back on the road.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama sought to reassure older Americans on Tuesday that health reform would not disrupt their Medicare coverage or force them to change doctors.

headline.main: Obama on Health Care for Seniors

docs.abstract: President Obama told retirees he wants every American to have the kind of security afforded seniors by Medicare.
docs.snippet: President Obama told retirees he wants every American to have the kind of security afforded seniors by Medicare.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Mexico City, the local government announced a plan to lure tourists by offering what is billed as free medical care in case of accidents or disease.

headline.main: Mexico: Free Health Insurance for Tourists

docs.snippet: In Mexico City, the local government announced a plan to lure tourists by offering what is billed as free medical care in case of accidents or disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration should establish an independent agency charged with identifying and eliminating the causes of medical error.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration should establish an independent agency charged with identifying and eliminating the causes of medical error.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama tried to sell his health care plan to older Americans amid an outpouring of fear about Medicare cuts.

headline.main: Democrats Push Health Care Plan While Issuing Assurances on Medicare
headline.print_headline: Democrats Push Health Care Plan While Issuing Assurances on Medicare

docs.snippet: President Obama tried to sell his health care plan to older Americans amid an outpouring of fear about Medicare cuts.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

docs.lead_paragraph: Chong-mun Chae avoided high premiums by claiming he had only one employee at his Queens company when he really had dozens doing hazardous work.

headline.seo: Chong-mun Chae Jailed for Workers’ Compensation Fraud in New York
headline.main: Asbestos Contractor Jailed for Cheating Workers’ Compensation Insurers
headline.print_headline: Asbestos Contractor Jailed for Cheating Workers’ Compensation Insurers

docs.lead_paragraph: Taxing health care may be the surest way to slow its growth, but members of Congress are not so eager.

headline.sub: In the Reform Debate, An Unpopular Answer Rises Up in Washington;
headline.seo: Health Care Reform and the Unpopular T-Word
headline.main: Health Care Reform and the Unpopular T-Word

docs.snippet: Taxing health care may be the surest way to slow its growth, but members of Congress are not so eager.
